item.title: Actually using dwm/st, I use dwm/st btw
item.description: Installing dwm and st is really, really easy. Maybe a bit harder, when you don’t have sudo.

item.title: Improving Shell Syntax of Git with Fzf
item.description: I really like this project myself, it’s written by that same guy who made fzf and it works out of the box.

item.title: Shell File Manager
item.description: I put a lot of time nurturing this shell script. As a result it comes with many functionalities, but I consider them all essential.

item.title: Organize Your Git Repositories
item.description: They said github is one of your business cards, I took it a bit seriously. I’ve got a lot of repositories that serve their purposes, but I feel all of them become hard to maintain once you stop keeping track of them, so I decided to change it, once and for all.

item.title: If Your School Runs Computers on Linux
item.description: Once I had some time to spare, I decided to spend it on hacking the computers in our school laboratories. While happiness would take over me after I succesfully connected my laptop to eduroam via wpa_supplicant , I began to consider installing dwm without sudo.
